title: arzuo
author: arzuo
content: As Salamu Alaikum / Namaskar / Helloto Respected members and friends of this forum, I am a new member of this forum I hope all will help me.I want to create a book like a story to present and understand Bitcoin in a simple way.I have knowledge about Inflation, Economics, Blockchain and BitcoinSo I would like to discuss the following 12 point in the book as a delightful story about bitcoin. I need some more suggestions from you, please advise me what else I should add: My 12 point: 1) Discovery of exchange2) Start / story of currency circulation and inflation3) Gold coin circulation and revolutionary exchange 4) Limited and unlimited supply of currency5) Invention and misuse of fiat money as receipt of gold coins6) How inflation increases the price of daily commodities7) Relationship with inflation and commodity prices and their differences8 ) How inflation makes people poorer day by day9) The silent struggle of people to survive inflation and rising commodity prices10) Thoughts and Research of Great Men to Survive Inflation11) Blockchain technology was invented by an unknown great person or group called "Satoshi Nakamoto".12) The first product of blockchain technology was the invention of crypto currency (Bitcoin) which was inflationless and its first exchange.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Those points are more about the General Economy than Bitcoin and Blockchain. I mean you could use some of those points as an introduction but it would be nice if the Book focused on Bitcoin and not on the history of the Economy. From my point of view, there are 3 ways to see bitcoin.1.-Bitcoin as an Asset (Or Economic instrument). On this point, you can focus on the bitcoin price, the markets, and its evolution.2.-Bitcoin as a Technology. Here we can talk about Blockchain Technology and how a decentralized project was successful.3.-Bitcoin as Data Base. With the Ordinals we can use Bitcoin to save information on the blockchain, and that feature is not the favorite of the community but it is worth talking about it on its own topic.

comments.author: legiteum
comments.body: It sounds like you want to write a book about inflation, not Bitcoin. That's a much bigger topic, and Bitcoin is just one of literally millions of investments that one could use to counteract currency inflation.

comments.author: btc78
comments.body: Quote from: arzuo on June 12, 2024, 05:47:12 PM11) Blockchain technology was invented by an unknown great person or group called "Satoshi Nakamoto".12) The first product of blockchain technology was the invention of crypto currency (Bitcoin) which was inflationless and its first exchange.Are these 12 points the entire book or just an introduction?I know there has been already a book in progress also posted here in the forum (though i can't find it) about the history of bitcoin so I don't think you should focus on that as much anymore. Anyway it's quite confusing what you really want to focus in on your book. You shouldn't dive into other topics such as inflation in so much detail if you are just going to introduce bitcoin through it. Be brief and explain more about bitcoin if your book really is about bitcoin.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: I don't see any correlation between the first 10 points and the last 2 points, if you want to talk about inflation, then you should mention gold and stock, Bitcoin isn't the only one solution.You're wrong though Bitcoin wasn't the first currency that use blockchain technology, the first was eCash, but it's not inflationless, the first inflationless cryptocurrency was E-Gold.Quote from: seoincorporation on June 12, 2024, 06:09:00 PM3.-Bitcoin as Data Base. With the Ordinals we can use Bitcoin to save information on the blockchain, and that feature is not the favorite of the community but it is worth talking about it on its own topic.Not really accurate.Ordinals is the token in Bitcoin blockchain, while OP_RETURN is the script to save information.

comments.author: Catenaccio
comments.body: The bullish case for BitcoinBitcoin prehistory[HELP] 'The Bitcoin History Book 2008-2024' [RELEASE: September 2024Readable https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M8z4M4oV4WC_aIGWkn-tO_T7Nkllj47C/view?usp=sharingYou need to read those documentary resources and think what you can do better with your book.Quote from: Apocollapse on June 13, 2024, 04:22:37 AMYou're wrong though Bitcoin wasn't the first currency that use blockchain technology, the first was eCash, but it's not inflationless, the first inflationless cryptocurrency was E-Gold.More information on Bitcoin prehistory and cryptocurrency before Bitcoin in Saylor Academy.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: arzuo on June 12, 2024, 05:47:12 PMI want to create a book like a story to present and understand Bitcoin in a simple way.If you intend to discuss Bitcoin in a manner that will be easy to understand then most of these your twelve points will complicate issues. It might be better to discuss Bitcoin alone than to relate it with inflation and other economic factors. There are many concepts to discuss in Bitcoin that are very important for your readers to learn. Quote I need some more suggestions from you, please advise me what else I should add:It is important to know your targeted readers because it will help to know what to include in the book. However, the history of Bitcoin should be included, discussion about wallets, the Bitcoin cycle, wallet security, the difference between Bitcoin and fiat, the difference between Bitcoin and altcoins, etc. Reading some good books about Bitcoin such as the Whitepaper, Mastering Bitcoin by Andreas M. Antonopoulos, etc, will help you identify areas your book should cover.

comments.author: Volimack
comments.body: This is not new, many people have posted about bitcoin written books there are many posts on the forum if you research the forum well you will know a lot of information about bitcoin. You may have mentioned inflation but I don't see inflation related to bitcoin. Inflation applies to the country's economy. Bitcoin is being used with the advancement of blockchain technology.

comments.body: Quote from: arzuo on June 12, 2024, 05:47:12 PM I need some more suggestions from you, please advise me what else I should add:Since you've asked for advice and suggestions concerning your plan to write a book, what i will give is for you to make use of the major aspects of discussion on your project should focuses more on bitcoin and have it in relation to other headings or subject matters you have pointed out, bitcoin is what the people want and they will be more interested in seeing how it could be applied in other aspect of their daily lives and economy as well as finances.

comments.body: Quote from: Volimack on June 13, 2024, 12:40:57 PMThis is not new, many people have posted about bitcoin written books there are many posts on the forum if you research the forum well you will know a lot of information about bitcoin. You may have mentioned inflation but I don't see inflation related to bitcoin. Inflation applies to the country's economy. There are a lot of other features that bitcoin has that doesn’t necessarily concern inflation like for example decentralization and privacy.To me decentralization is the fundamental of bitcoin so it would be nice if you also explained that part in your book.

comments.author: Yucky
comments.body: Quote from: arzuo on June 12, 2024, 05:47:12 PMAs Salamu Alaikum / Namaskar / Helloto Respected members and friends of this forum, I am a new member of this forum I hope all will help me.I want to create a book like a story to present and understand Bitcoin in a simple way.I have knowledge about Inflation, Economics, Blockchain and BitcoinSo I would like to discuss the following 12 point in the book as a delightful story about bitcoin.before deciding to write a book, it's expected that you already have all the basic and advance knowledge about the subject matter you're writing in and not just scratching the surface. Most of the ideas you have here are readily available on goggle search engine and wouldn't be too useful for most folks who might be interested in your work. First off, it's necessary that you know everything there is to know about what you're writing so while writing it, you won't find deficulty conveying your message and information in a readable and easy to understand manner.In addition to this, one way to do well at things is to start the work first off then along the line, you can look at how far you've gone and put in the effort to go above the extent of your work. You need to have written some sort of a prototype and then you can tell us how far that is and then we can continue from that point in giving you better suggestions.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on June 12, 2024, 06:09:00 PMThose points are more about the General Economy than Bitcoin and Blockchain. Quote from: legiteum on June 12, 2024, 06:13:46 PMIt sounds like you want to write a book about inflation, not Bitcoin.Yeah....OP's ideas seem all over the place, and if this is a book about bitcoin (or something bitcoin-related), he might want to tie all of these concepts together as they relate to bitcoin, because I don't see how any of what he wrote is suitable for a book.OP, have you read any of the books that have already been written on the history of bitcoin?  There are two that I've read: Digital Gold and Bitcoin Billionaires.  They cover some of the same ground, but the authors wrote some very interesting stuff without rehashing things that had already been written about.  If you're going to focus specifically on some of the *very technical* economic aspects of bitcoin, I'm not confident you're going to find much of a following.  Just look on Amazon and you'll see that there are tons of self-published books dealing with various bitcoin angles.  Crypto in general is a very hot topic, but I don't think a lot of folks who want to learn about it (or are already passionate about crypto/bitcoin) look for printed material--or more specifically, the written word which would include Kindle and the like.But good luck with whatever you do.  You've got way more ambition than I've got, I'll tell ya that.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Quote from: arzuo on June 14, 2024, 06:21:33 AM...Thank you very muchReally like your advice and I picked your following points#Bitcoin as an Asset#Bitcoin as a Technology#And its a Data Base system.I will eliminate unnecessary things from my thinking.You are welcome arzuo. As you can see, the idea of blockchain as a database is a complex topic, not all the community agrees on that point, but i mentioned it because more than ordinals, you can see all the blocks and transactions in the blockchain, and you can request that information at any time. So, i hardly believe that blockchain can be implemented as a database with the feature that users can't modify the data on it. But good luck with the book, and let us know when is out, i would love to read it.
